intro: Lindackeria latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved lindackeria, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, which attract various pollinators. Lindackeria latifolia is typically found in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats.
